text: Buckner Stith Morris (August 19, 1800 - December 16, 1879) was an American politician. He was the Mayor of Chicago, Illinois from 1838 to 1839. He was a member of the Whig Party. He was in jail for 9 months because of war conflicts. Morris was born on August 19, 1800 in Augusta, Kentucky. Morris was married to Evlina Barker until her death. Then he was married to Elize Stephenson until her death. Then he was married to M. E. Parrish until his death. He had three children. Morris died on December 16, 1879 in Chicago, Illinois from an illness, aged 79. ==References== Category:1800 births Category:1879 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Chicago Category:Burials at Rosehill Cemetery Category:Whig Party (United States) politicians Category:Mayors of Chicago Category:Politicians from Kentucky Category:Lawyers from Chicago Category:Chicago City Council members
title: Buckner Stith Morris
